Get a Minimal Version of the Account Tree

Source: R/helpers.R
minimal_tree.Rd

Retrieves a lightweight representation of an account object, containing only essential details. This is particularly useful for front-end initialization, as it avoids fetching large volumes of data or making multiple batch requests.

Usage

minimal_tree(account, n = 30, daterange = c(Sys.Date() - 365000, Sys.Date()))

Arguments

account

An R6 account object from the finman package.

n

Integer. The number of days within which to compute the amount due. Default is 30.

daterange

A length-2 Date vector specifying the date range for statistics (spending, total due, etc.). Default is from 1,000 years ago to today (c(Sys.Date() - 365000, Sys.Date())).

Value

A list containing:

  • name – Account name.

  • account_uuid – Account unique identifier.

  • balance – Current account balance.

  • transactions – Transaction history.

  • child_accounts_list – Summary list of child accounts (name and UUID).

  • total_balance – Total balance including child accounts.

  • total_due – Total amount due including child accounts.

  • compute_total_due_within_n_days – Amount due within the specified period.

  • spending, total_income, allocated_amount, income_utilization, walking_amount_due, walking_balance – Computed statistics for the specified date range.

  • parent_uuid, allocation, account_status, priority – Additional details for ChildAccount objects.

  • due_date, fixed_amount, account_type, account_freq, account_periods – Additional details for GrandchildAccount objects.

  • child_accounts – Recursively minimal child account trees.

Examples

if (FALSE) {
library(finman)

# Create main account
main_account <- MainAccount$new("Main")

# Add tier 2 accounts
main_account$add_child_account(
  ChildAccount$new("Needs", allocation = 0.55))
main_account$add_child_account(
  ChildAccount$new("Goals", allocation = 0.25))
main_account$add_child_account(
  ChildAccount$new("Debt Repayment", allocation = 0.20))

# Add tier 3 accounts (example: Needs -> Rent)
main_account$child_accounts$`Needs`$add_child_account(
  GrandchildAccount$new(
    "Rent",
    allocation = 0.20,
    fixed_amount = 7500,
    account_type = "Bill",
    freq = 30,
    due_date = dmy("28-1-2025")
  )
)

# Deposit and withdraw
main_account$deposit(10000, "TXN001", "Mpesa")
main_account$find_account("Rent")$withdraw(200, "TXN005", "Cash")

# Get minimal account tree
tree <- minimal_tree(main_account)
}
